classitems.description: Indicates whether the animation is playing in reverse or not.
classitems.name: _reverse

classitems.description: Whether the animation is to be played in reverse.
classitems.name: reverse

classitems.description: The time at which the animation should change to the next cell
classitems.name: _tick

classitems.description: If the animation is currently playing or not.
classitems.name: _isPlaying

classitems.description: If the animation is currently playing or not.
classitems.name: isPlaying

classitems.description: A Kiwi.Signal that dispatches an event when the animation has stopped playing.
classitems.name: _onStop

classitems.description: A Kiwi.Signal that dispatches an event when the animation has started playing.
classitems.name: _onPlay

classitems.description: A Kiwi.Signal that dispatches an event when the animation has updated/changed frameIndexs.
classitems.name: _onUpdate

classitems.description: A Kiwi.Signal that dispatches an event when the animation has come to the end of the animation and is going to play again.
classitems.name: _onLoop

classitems.description: An Internal method used to start the animation.
classitems.name: _start

params.name: index
params.description: The index of the frame in the sequence that is to play. If left as null if just starts from where it left off.

classitems.description: Plays the animation.
classitems.name: play

classitems.description: Plays the animation at a particular frame
classitems.name: playAt

params.name: index
params.description: The index of the cell in the sequence that the animation is to start at.

classitems.description: Pauses the current animation.
classitems.name: pause

classitems.description: Resumes the current animation after stopping.
classitems.name: resume

classitems.description: Stops the current animation from playing.
classitems.name: stop

classitems.description: Makes the animation go to the next frame. If the animation is at the end it goes back to the start.
classitems.name: nextFrame

classitems.description: Makes the animation go to the previous frame. If the animation is at the first frame it goes to the end.
classitems.name: prevFrame

classitems.description: The update loop. Returns a boolean indicating whether the animation has gone to a new frame or not.
classitems.name: update

classitems.description: An internal method used to check to see if frame passed is valid or not
classitems.name: _validateFrame

params.name: frame
params.description: The index of the frame that is to be validated.

classitems.description: Returns the number of frames that in the animation. Thus the animations 'length'. Note this is READ ONLY.
classitems.name: length

classitems.description: Destroys the anim and all of the properties that exist on it.
classitems.name: destroy

classitems.description: The name of this sequence.
classitems.name: name

classitems.description:
The cells that are in this animation.
These are a reference to the cells that are contained in a texture atlas that this sequence should be a part of.
classitems.name: cells

classitems.description: The time an animation should spend on each cell.
classitems.name: speed

classitems.description: If the sequence should play again if it was animating and the animation reaches the last frame.
classitems.name: loop

classitems.description:
Dispatches callbacks each time an animation is told to play through this AnimationManager.
Functions dispatched from this signal have ONE Parameter.
One - The Animation object of that is now playing.
classitems.name: onPlay

classitems.description:
Dispatches callbacks each time an animation stops. 
Functions dispatched from this signal have ONE parameter.
One - The current animation.
classitems.name: onStop

classitems.description:
Dispatches callbacks each time the cell of the Sprite this AnimationManager belongs to updates/changes.
Note: This method will be dispatching events EVERY time the cell changes, so this will include when changing/switching animations.
classitems.name: onUpdate

classitems.description:
Dispatches callbacks each time the current animation is switched NOT when the cells of a animation change.
Function's dispatched from this event have TWO parameters, 
One - Name of the animation switched to.
Two - The Animation object that is now the current.
classitems.name: onChange

classitems.description: The entity that this animation belongs to and thus is effecting.
classitems.name: entity

classitems.description:
The texture atlas that this animation is taking effect on.
The value of this should be the same as the Entity.
classitems.name: _atlas

classitems.description: A Object containing all of the animations that are avaiable to be used.
classitems.name: _animations

classitems.description: A reference to the animation that is currently being played.
classitems.name: currentAnimation

classitems.description: Returns a boolean indicating whether or not the current animation is playing. This is READ ONLY.
classitems.name: isPlaying

classitems.description: Returns a string indicating the type of object that this is.
classitems.name: objType

classitems.description:
Creates a new Animation (by creating a Sequence) that can then be played on this AnimationManager. 
If you pass to this the name of a Animation that already exists, then the previous Animation will be overridden by this new one. 
Note: If the Animation you have overridden was the currentAnimation, then the previous Animation will keep playing until a different Animation is switched to.
By default new Animation Sequences are also added to the TextureAtlas, which can then be inherited.
Returns the Animation that was created.
classitems.name: add

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the animation that is to be created.

params.name: cells
params.description: An array of numbers, which are reference to each cell that is to be played in the Animation in order.

params.name: speed
params.description: The amount of time that each cell in the Animation should stay on screen for. In seconds.

params.name: loop
params.description: If when the Animation reaches the last frame, it should go back to the start again.

params.name: play
params.description: If once created the animation should played right away.

params.name: addToAtlas
params.description: If the new Sequence created should be added to the TextureAtlas or not.

classitems.description:
Creates a new Animation based on a Sequence that is passed. 
If you pass to this the name of a Animation that already exists, then the previous Animation will be overridden by this new one. 
Note: If the Animation you have overridden was the currentAnimation, then the previous Animation will keep playing until a different Animation is switched to.
Returns the Animation that was created.
classitems.name: createFromSequence

params.name: sequence
params.description: The sequence that the Animation is based on.

params.name: play
params.description: If the Animation should played once it has been created

classitems.description: Plays either the current animation or the name of the animation that you pass.
classitems.name: play

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the animation that you want to play. If not passed it plays the current animation.

params.name: resetTime
params.description: When set to false, this will prevent a new Animation from playing if it is already the currentAnimation that is already playing.

return.description: Returns the current Animation that is now playing.

classitems.description:
Plays an Animation at a particular frameIndex.
Note: The frameIndex is a particular index of a cell in the Sequence of the Animation you would like to play. 
Example: If you had a Animation with a Sequence [0, 1, 2, 3] and you told it to play at index '2', then the cell that it would be at is '3'.
classitems.name: playAt

params.name: index
params.description: The index of the frame in the Sequence that you would like to play.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the animation that you want to play. If not passed, it attempts to play it on the current animation.

return.description: Returns the current Animation that is now playing.

classitems.description: An internal method used to actually play a Animation at a Index.
classitems.name: _play

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the animation that is to be switched to.

params.name: index
params.description: The index of the frame in the Sequence that is to play. If null, then it restarts the animation at the cell it currently is at.

return.description: Returns the current Animation that is now playing.

classitems.description: Stops the current animation from playing.
classitems.name: stop

classitems.description: Pauses the current animation.
classitems.name: pause

classitems.description:
Resumes the current animation.
The animation should have already been paused.
classitems.name: resume

classitems.description:
Either switches to a particular animation OR a particular frame in the current animation depending on if you pass the name of an animation that exists on this Manager (as a string) or a number refering to a frame index on the Animation. 
When you switch to a particular animation then 
You can also force the animation to play or to stop by passing a boolean in. But if left as null, the state of the Animation will based off what is currently happening.
So if the animation is currently 'playing' then once switched to the animation will play. If not currently playing it will switch to and stop.
If the previous animation played is non-looping and has reached its final frame, it is no longer considered playing, and as such, switching to another animation will not play unless the argument to the play parameter is true.
classitems.name: switchTo

params.name: play
params.description: Force the animation to play or stop. If null the animation base's it off what is currently happening.

classitems.description: Makes the current animation go to the next frame. If the animation is at the end of the sequence it then goes back to the start.
classitems.name: nextFrame

classitems.description: Makes the current animation go to the prev frame. If the animation is at the start, the animation will go the end of the sequence.
classitems.name: prevFrame

classitems.description: Internal method that sets the current animation to a Animation passed.
classitems.name: _setCurrentAnimation

params.name: name
params.description: Name of the Animation that is to be switched to.

classitems.description:
The update loop for this component. 
Only updates the currentAnimation and only if it is playing.
classitems.name: update

classitems.description: Gets the cell that the current Animation is current at. This is READ ONLY.
classitems.name: currentCell

classitems.description: Gets the current frame index of the cell in the Sequence that is currently playing. This is READ ONLY.
classitems.name: frameIndex

classitems.description: Returns the length (Number of cells) of the current Animation that is playing. This is READ ONLY.
classitems.name: length

classitems.description:
Returns a Animation that is on this AnimationComponent
Does not check to see if that Animation exists or not.
classitems.name: getAnimation

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the Animation you would like to get.

return.description: The Animation that is found. Will be 'undefined' if a Animation with that name did not exist.

classitems.description: An internal method that is used to update the cell index of an entity when an animation says it needs to update.
classitems.name: updateCellIndex

classitems.description: Destroys the animation component and runs the destroy method on all of the anims that it has.
classitems.name: destroy

classitems.description: The transform component of the entity that the ArcadePhysics is a part of.
classitems.name: transform

classitems.description:
The bounding box component that the collisions are going to be based off.
You can modify the 'hitbox' of that component to modify the collision area.
classitems.name: box

classitems.description: Whether an object will move/alter position after a collision.
classitems.name: immovable

classitems.description:
The basic speed of this object.
You can modify the values contained inside this Object to change the speed.
classitems.name: velocity

classitems.description: The virtual mass of the object. Default value is 1. Currently only used with elasticity during collision resolution. Change at your own risk; effects seem crazy unpredictable so far!
classitems.name: mass

classitems.description: The bounciness of this object.  Only affects collisions.  Default value is 0, or "not bouncy at all."
classitems.name: elasticity

classitems.description:
How fast the speed of this object is changing.
Useful for smooth movement and gravity.
classitems.name: acceleration

classitems.description:
This isn't drag exactly, more like deceleration that is only applied
when acceleration is not affecting the sprite.
classitems.name: drag

classitems.description: If you are using acceleration, you can use maxVelocity with it to cap the speed automatically (very useful!).
classitems.name: maxVelocity

classitems.description: This is how fast you want this sprite to spin.
classitems.name: angularVelocity

classitems.description: How fast the spin speed should change.
classitems.name: angularAcceleration

classitems.description: Like drag but for spinning.
classitems.name: angularDrag

classitems.description: Use in conjunction with angularAcceleration for fluid spin speed control.
classitems.name: maxAngular

classitems.description: If the Entity that this component is a part of 'moves' or not, and thus if the physics should update the motion should update each frame.
classitems.name: moves

classitems.description:
Bit field of flags (use with UP, DOWN, LEFT, RIGHT, etc) indicating surface contacts.
Use bitwise operators to check the values stored here, or use touching(), justStartedTouching(), etc.
You can even use them broadly as boolean values if you're feeling saucy!
classitems.name: touching

classitems.description:
Bit field of flags (use with UP, DOWN, LEFT, RIGHT, etc) indicating surface contacts from the previous game loop step.
Use bitwise operators to check the values stored here, or use isTouching().
You can even use them broadly as boolean values if you're feeling saucy!
classitems.name: wasTouching

classitems.description:
Bit field of flags (use with UP, DOWN, LEFT, RIGHT, etc) indicating collision directions.
Use bitwise operators to check the values stored here.
Useful for things like one-way platforms (e.g. allowCollisions = UP)
The accessor "solid" just flips this variable between NONE and ANY.
classitems.name: allowCollisions

classitems.description:
Important variable for collision processing.
Tracks the last location of the Entity. This is set during the time this method 'updates'.
classitems.name: last

classitems.description: A boolean to indicate if this object is solid or not.
classitems.name: _solid

classitems.description: A function that is to execute when this object overlaps with another.
classitems.name: _callbackFunction

classitems.description: The context that the callback method should have when it executes.
classitems.name: _callbackContext

classitems.description:
Returns a boolean indicating whether the or not the object is currently colliding on a particular side that is passed.
Use the collision constants (like LEFT, FLOOR, e.t.c) when passing sides.
classitems.name: touching

params.name: value
params.description: [number] The collision constant of the side you want to check against.

return.description: If the Object is currently colliding on that side or not.

classitems.description:
Whether the object should collide with other objects or not.  
For more control over what directions the object will collide from, use collision constants (like LEFT, FLOOR, etc)
and set the value of allowCollisions directly.
classitems.name: solid

params.name: value
params.description: If left empty, this will then just toggle between ANY and NONE.

return.description: If Object is currently solid or not.

classitems.description:
Sets up a callback function that will run when this object overlaps with another.
When the method is dispatched it will have TWO arguments.
One - The parent / entity of this ArcadePhysics.
Two - The GameObject that the collision occured with.
classitems.name: setCallback

params.name: callbackFunction
params.description: The method that is to be executed whe a overlap occurs.

params.name: callbackContext
params.description: The context that the method is to be called in.

classitems.description: Returns the parent of this entity. Mainly used for executing callbacks.
classitems.name: parent

classitems.description:
A static method for seperating two normal GameObjects on both the X and Y Axis's. 
Both objects need to have both an ArcadePhysics Component and a Box component in order for the separate process to succeed.
This method is not recommended to be directly used but instead use a 'collide/overlaps' method instead.
classitems.name: seperate

params.name: object1
params.description: The first GameObject you would like to seperate.

params.name: object2
params.description: The second GameObject you would like to seperate from the first.

classitems.description:
Separates two passed GameObjects on the x-axis.
Both objects need to have both an ArcadePhysics Component and a Box component in order for the separate process to succeed.
This method is not recommended to be directly used but instead use a 'collide/overlaps' method instead.
classitems.name: seperateX

params.name: object1
params.description: The first GameObject.

params.name: object2
params.description: The second GameObject.

return.description: Whether the objects in fact touched and were separated along the X axis.

classitems.description:
Separates two GameObject on the y-axis. This method is executed from the 'separate' method.
Both objects need to have both an ArcadePhysics Component and a Box component in order for the separate process to succeed.
This method is not recommended to be directly used but instead use a 'collide/overlaps' method instead.
classitems.name: seperateY

params.name: object1
params.description: The first GameObject.

params.name: object2
params.description: The second GameObject.

return.description: Whether the objects in fact touched and were separated along the Y axis.

classitems.description:
Separates a GameObject from a series of passed Tiles that lie on a TileMapLayer. 
The gameobject needs to have a Box Component and an ArcadePhysics Component. 
This method is not recommended to be directly used but instead use the 'overlapsTiles' method instead.
classitems.name: separateTiles

params.name: object
params.description: The GameObject you are wanting to separate from a tile.

params.name: layer
params.description: The TileMapLayer that the tiles belong on.

classitems.description: Separates a GameObjects from an Array of Tiles on the x-axis.
classitems.name: separateTilesX

params.name: object
params.description: The GameObject you are wanting to separate from a tile.

params.name: layer
params.description: The TileMapLayer that the tiles belong on.

params.name: tile
params.description: An Object containing the information (x/y/tiletypr) about the tile that is being overlapped.

classitems.description: Separates a GameObject from a tiles on the y-axis.
classitems.name: separateTilesY

params.name: object
params.description: The GameObject you are wanting to separate from a tile.

params.name: layer
params.description: The TileMapLayer that the tiles belong on.

params.name: tiles
params.description: An Object representing the Tile which we are checking to see any overlaps occurs.

classitems.description:
A method to check to see if any Tiles with in this parent TileMapLayer overlaps with a GameObject passed.
If seperateObjects is true it will seperate the two entities based on their bounding box.
ONLY works if the parent of the ArcadePhysics component which is calling this method is a TileMapLayer.
Note: The GameObject passed must contain a box component and only if you want to separate the two objects must is ALSO contain an ArcadePhysics component.
classitems.name: overlapsTiles

params.name: gameObject
params.description: The GameObject you would like to separate with this one.

params.name: separateObjects
params.description: If you want the GameObject to be separated from any tile it collides with.

params.name: collisionType
params.description: If you want the GameObject to only check for collisions from a particular side of tiles. ANY by default.

classitems.description:
A method to check to see if the parent of this physics component overlaps with another Kiwi.Entity.
If seperateObjects is true it will seperate the two entities based on their bounding box.
Note: The GameObject passed must contain a box component and only if you want to separate the two objects must is ALSO contain an ArcadePhysics component. 
Also: Not to be used for separation from tiles.
classitems.name: overlaps

classitems.description: A method to check to see if the parent of this physics component overlaps with another individual in a Kiwi Group.
classitems.name: overlapsGroup

return.description: If any object in the group overlapped with the GameObject or not.

classitems.description: A method to check to see if the parent of this physics component overlaps with any Entities that are held in an Array which is passed.
classitems.name: overlapsArray

params.name: array
params.description: The array of GameObjects you want to check.

params.name: separateObjects
params.description: If when the objects collide you want them to seperate outwards.

classitems.description:
The number of frames since the game was launched.

Use this to drive cyclic animations. You may manually reset it in a Kiwi.State.create() function to restart the count from 0.

The largest exact integer value of a JavaScript number is 2^53, or 9007199254740992. At 60 frames per second, this will take 4,760,273 years to become inaccurate.

classitems.description:
The number of ideal frames since the game was launched.

Use this to drive cyclic animations. This will be smoother than using the frame parameter. It is derived from the total time elapsed since the game launched.

classitems.description: Add a new listener/callback to this Signal.

params.description: Signal handler function.

params.name: listenerContext
params.description: Context on which listener will be executed (object that should represent the `this` variable inside listener function).

params.name: priority
params.description: The priority level of the event listener. Listeners with higher priority will be executed before listeners with lower priority. Listeners with same priority level will be executed at the same order as they were added. (default = 0)

return.description: An Object representing the binding between the Signal and listener.

classitems.description: Add listener to the signal that should be removed after first execution (will be executed only once).

return.description: An Object representing the binding between the Signal and listener.

classitems.description: Remove a single listener from the dispatch queue.

classitems.description:
The default scaling method used on Kiwi Games. 
This scaling method will set the containers width/height to static values.
classitems.name: SCALE_NONE

classitems.description:
Scale Fit will scale the stages width to fit its parents width.
The height is then calculated to maintain the aspect ratio of the width/height of the Stage.
classitems.name: SCALE_FIT

classitems.description:
Stretch will make the stage scale to fit its parents width/height (by using max/min height of 100%).
If the parent doesn't have a height set then the height will be the height of the stage.
classitems.name: SCALE_STRETCH

Calculates and returns the amount that the container has been scale by.  
Mainly used for re-calculating input coordinates. 
Note: For COCOONJS this returns 1 since COCOONJS translates the scale itself.

classitems.description:
The background color of the stage. 
This must be a valid 6 character hex color string such as "ffffff".
classitems.name: _color

classitems.description:
Sets the background color of the stage via a hex value.

The hex colour code should not contain a hashtag '#'.

The hex value can optionally contain an alpha term, which defaults to full ("ff", "255" or "1.0" depending on context). For example, both "ff0000" and "ff0000ff" will evaluate to an opaque red.
classitems.name: color

classitems.description:
Allows the setting of the background color of the stage through component RGB colour values.

This property is an Object Literal with 'r', 'g', 'b' colour streams of values between 0 and 255.
classitems.name: rgbColor

classitems.description:
Allows the setting of the background color of the stage through component RGBA colour values.

This property is an Object Literal with 'r', 'g', 'b', 'a' colour streams of values between 0 and 255.

Note that the alpha value is from 0-255, not 0-1. This is to preserve compatibility with hex-style color values, e.g. "ff0000ff".
classitems.name: rgbaColor

classitems.description: Stores the normalized background color of the stage as a RGBA values between 0 and 1.
classitems.name: _normalizedColor

This is READ ONLY.

classitems.description:
Creates a debug canvas and adds it above the regular game canvas.
The debug canvas is not created by default (even with debugging on) and rendering/clearing of the canvas is upto the developer. 
The context for rendering can be access via the 'dctx' property and you can use the 'clearDebugCanvas' method to clear the canvas.

If not colour is passed then Red at 20% opacity is used.

classitems.description:
Holds all of the textures that are avaiable to be accessed once this state has been loaded.
E.g. If you loaded a image and named it 'flower', once everything has loaded you can then access the flower image by saying this.textures.flower
classitems.name: textures

classitems.description:
Holds all of the audio that are avaiable to be accessed once this state has been loaded.
E.g. If you loaded a piece of audio and named it 'lazerz', once everything has loaded you can then access the lazers (pew pew) by saying this.audio.lazerz
classitems.name: audio

classitems.description:
Holds all of the data that are avaiable to be accessed once this state has been loaded.
E.g. If you loaded a piece of data and named it 'cookieLocation', once everything has loaded you can then access the cookies by saying this.data.cookieLocation

classitems.description:
This method is executed when this State is about to be switched too. This is the first method to be executed, and happens before the Init method.
Is called each time a State is switched to.
classitems.name: boot

classitems.description:
Gets executed when the state has been initalised and gets switched to for the first time.
This method only ever gets called once and it is before the preload method.
Can have parameters passed to it by the previous state that switched to it.

classitems.description: This method is where you would load of all the assets that are requried for this state or in the entire game.

classitems.description:
This method is progressively called whilst loading files and is executed each time a file has been loaded.
This can be used to create a 'progress' bar during the loading stage of a game.
classitems.name: loadProgress

params.name: percent
params.description: The percent of files that have been loaded so far. This is a number from 0 - 1.

params.description: The number of bytes that have been loaded so far.

params.name: file
params.description: The last file to have been loaded.

classitems.description: Is executed once all of the assets have loaded and the game is ready to be 'created'.

classitems.name: preUpdate

classitems.description: The update loop that is executed every frame while the game is 'playing'. When overriding make sure you include a super call too.
classitems.name: update

classitems.description:
The post update loop is executed every frame after the update method. 
When overriding make sure you include a super call at the end of the method.
classitems.name: postUpdate

classitems.description: Called after all of the layers have rendered themselves, useful for debugging.
classitems.name: postRender

classitems.description: Called just before this State is going to be Shut Down and another one is going to be switched too.

params.description: If the image should be deleted when switching to another state or if the other states should still be able to access this image.

params.name: width
params.description: The width of the image. If not passed the width will be automatically calculated.

params.name: height
params.description: The height of the image. If not passed the height will be automatically calculated.

params.description: The offset of the image when rendering on the x axis.

params.name: offsetY
params.description: The offset of the image when rendering on the y axis.

classitems.description: Adds a new spritesheet image file that is be loaded when the state gets up to the loading all of the assets.

params.name: key
params.description: A key for this image so that you can access it when the loading has finished.

params.name: url
params.description: The location of the image.

params.name: frameWidth
params.description: The width of a single frame in the spritesheet

params.name: frameHeight
params.description: The height of a single frame in the spritesheet

params.name: storeAsGlobal
params.description: If the image should be deleted when switching to another state or if the other states should still be able to access this image.

params.name: numCells
params.description: The number of cells/frames that are in the spritesheet. If not specified will calculate this based of the width/height of the image.

params.name: rows
params.description: The number of cells that are in a row. If not specified will calculate this based of the width/height of the image.

params.name: cols
params.description: The number of cells that are in a column. If not specified will calculate this based of the width/height of the image.

params.name: sheetOffsetX
params.description: The offset of the whole spritesheet on the x axis.

params.name: sheetOffsetY
params.description: The offset of the whole spritesheet on the y axis.

params.name: cellOffsetX
params.description: The spacing between cells on the x axis.

params.name: cellOffsetY
params.description: The spacing between cells on the y axis.

Otherwise you can pass the state object as well and it will load it then swap to it.

classitems.description:
If when loading the file in we have loaded the file in using a tag loader (older browsers) or we are using the an XHR loader + array buffer.
By default we use the tag loader and only used the second method if the browser supports it.
classitems.name: _useTagLoader

classitems.description: Holds the type of data that is being loaded. This should be used with the STATIC properties that hold the various datatypes that can be loaded.
classitems.name: dataType

classitems.description: The 'key' is the user defined name and the users way of accessing this file once loaded.
classitems.name: key

classitems.description: The name of the file being loaded.
classitems.name: fileName

classitems.description:
The location of where the file is placed without the file itself (So without the files name).
Example: If the file you are load is located at 'images/awesomeImage.png' then the filepath will be 'images/'
classitems.name: filePath

classitems.description:
The type of file that is being loaded.
Is only ever given a value when used with the XHR method of loading OR if you use 'getFileDetails' before hand.
The value is based off of the 'Content-Type' of the XHR's response header returns.
classitems.name: fileType

classitems.description:
The extension of the file that is being loaded.
This is based upon what the file path that the developer (you) specify.
classitems.name: fileExtension

classitems.description: The full filepath including the file itself.
classitems.name: fileURL

classitems.description:
The size of the file that was/is being loaded. 
Only has a value when the file was loaded by the XHR method OR you request the file information before hand using 'getFileDetails'.
classitems.name: fileSize

classitems.description:
The Entity Tag that is assigned to the file. O
Only has a value when either using the XHR loader OR when requesting the file details.
classitems.name: ETag

classitems.description:
The last date/time that this file was last modified. 
Only has a value when using the XHR method of loading OR when requesting the file details.
classitems.name: lastModified

classitems.description: The time at which the loading started. Only has a value when the XHR method of loading is in use.
classitems.name: timeStarted

classitems.description: The time at which the load finished. Only has a value if loading the file was successful and when the XHR method of loading is in use.
classitems.name: timeFinished

classitems.description: The duration or how long it took to load the file. In milliseconds.
classitems.name: duration

classitems.description: If the loading of the file failed or encountered an error.
classitems.name: hasError

classitems.description: If the loading was a success or not.
classitems.name: success

classitems.description: Holds the error (if there was one) when loading the file.
classitems.name: error

classitems.name: lastProgress

classitems.description: The amount of percent loaded the file is. This is out of 100.
classitems.name: percentLoaded

classitems.description: The particular piece of data that the developer wanted loaded. This is in a format that is based upon the datatype passed.
classitems.name: data

classitems.description:
A dictionary, stores any information relating to this file.
Is useful when loading images that are to be used as a spritesheet or texture atlas.

params.name: maxLoadAttempts
params.description: The maximum amount of times to try and load this file.

params.name: timeout
params.description: The timeout to use when loading the file. Overrides the default timeout if passed otherwise uses the default 2000 milliseconds.

classitems.description:
Is executed when this file starts loading. 
Gets the time and initalised properties that are used across both loading methods.
classitems.name: start

classitems.description: Is executed when this file stops loading. Used across all loading methods.
classitems.name: stop

classitems.description:
Handles the loading of the file when using the tag loader method. 
Only supports the IMAGES and AUDIO files.
classitems.name: tagLoader

classitems.description: Is executed when the tag loader encounters a error that stops it from loading.

classitems.description: Is executed when an audio file can play the whole way through with stopping to load.

classitems.description:
Is executed when iOS (or another device) is being used and the audio is 'locked'.
'Fakes' the loading and tells the rest of the game to carry on.

classitems.description: Is executed when the file has successfully loaded.
classitems.name: tagLoaderOnLoad

classitems.description:
The status of this file that is being loaded. 
Only used/has a value when the file was/is being loaded by the XHR method.
classitems.name: status

classitems.description: The status piece of text that the XHR returns.
classitems.name: statusText

classitems.description:
The number of bytes that have currently been loaded. 
This can used to create progress bars but only has a value when using the XHR method of loading.

classitems.description:
The total number of bytes that the file consists off.
Only has a value when using the XHR method of loading.

classitems.description: The ready state of the XHR loader whilst loading.

classitems.description:
The default number of milliseconds that the XHR should wait before timing out.
Set this to NULL if you want it to not timeout.

classitems.description: If this file has timeout when it was loading.
classitems.name: hasTimedOut

classitems.description: If the file timed out or not.
classitems.name: timedOut

classitems.description:
The number of attempts at loading there have currently been at loading the file.
This is only used with XHR methods of loading.
classitems.name: attemptCounter

classitems.description:
The maximum attempts at loading the file that there is allowed.
Only used with XHR methods of loading.

classitems.name: buffer

classitems.description: Runs when the XHR loader aborts the load for some reason.
classitems.name: xhrOnAbort

classitems.description: Runs when the XHR loader encounters a error.
classitems.name: xhrOnError

classitems.description: Is executed when the xhr
classitems.name: xhrOnTimeout

classitems.description: Is execute whilst loading of the file is occuring. Updates the number of bytes that have been loaded and percentage loaded.

params.name: event
params.description: The XHR event.

classitems.description:
Handles the processing of the files information when it was loaded via the xhr + arraybuffer method. 
Is only executed when the loading was a success

Revokes the object url that was added to the window when creating the image.

classitems.description:
Attempts to make the file send a XHR HEAD request to get information about the file that is going to be downloaded.
This is particularly useful when you are wanting to check how large a file is before loading all of the content.

params.description: The timeout delay. By default this is the same as the timeout delay property set on this file.

classitems.description:
Creates a new File to store a audio piece. 
This method firstly checks to see if the AUDIO file being loaded is supported or not by the browser/device before adding it to the loading queue.
You can override this behaviour and tell the audio data to load even if not supported by setting the 'onlyIfSupported' boolean to false.
Also you can now pass an array of filepaths, and the first audio filetype that is supported will be loaded.
classitems.name: addAudio

params.name: key
params.description: The key for the audio file.

params.name: url
params.description: The url of the audio to load. You can pass an array of URLs, in which case the first supported audio filetype in the array will be loaded.

params.name: storeAsGlobal
params.description: If the file should be stored globally.

params.name: onlyIfSupported
params.description: If the audio file should only be loaded if Kiwi detects that the audio file could be played. Set this to fa

classitems.description:
Creates new tilemap layers from a JSON file that you pass (has to be in the Tiled Format).
The texture atlas you pass is that one that each TileMapLayer found in the JSON will use, You can change the TextureAtlas afterwards.
New TileTypes will automatically be created. The number is based on the Tileset parameter of the JSON. 
The cell used for new TileTypes will begin at 0 and increment each time a new TileType is created (and a cell exists). Otherwise new TileTypes will start will a cell of -1 (none).
classitems.name: createFromFileStore

params.name: tileMapData
params.description: This can either

params.name: atlas
params.description: The texture atlas that you would like the tilemap layers to use.

params.name: startingCell
params.description: The number for the initial cell that the first TileType should use. If you pass -1 then no new TileTypes will be created.

classitems.description:
Creates a new TileMapLayer with the details that are provided. 
If no width/height/tileWidth/tileHeight parameters are passed then the values will be what this TileMap has.
If no 'data' is provided then the map will be automatically filled with empty Types of Tiles.
Returns the new TileMapLayer that was created.
classitems.name: createNewLayer

params.name: name
params.description: Name of the TileMap.

params.name: atlas
params.description: The TextureAtlas that this layer should use.

params.name: data
params.description: The tile information.

params.name: w
params.description: The width of the whole tile map. In Tiles.

params.name: h
params.description: The height of the whole tile map. In Tiles.

params.name: x
params.description: The position of the tilemap on the x axis. In pixels.

params.name: y
params.description: The position of the tilemap on the y axis. In pixels.

params.name: tw
params.description: The width of a single tile.

params.name: th
params.description: The height of a single tile.

classitems.description: Eventually will create a new object layer. Currently does nothing.
classitems.name: createNewObjectLayer

classitems.description: Eventually will create a new image layer. Currently does nothing.
classitems.name: createNewObjectLayer

classitems.description:
-----------------------
 TileMapLayer Management Functions
-----------------------

Get a layer by the name that it was given upon creation.
Returns null if no layer with that name was found.
classitems.name: getLayerByName

params.name: name
params.description: Name of the layer you would like to select.

return.description: Either the layer with the name passed, or null if no Layer with that name was found.

classitems.description: Returns the layer with the number associated with it in the layers array.
classitems.name: getLayer

params.name: num
params.description: Number of the Layer you would like to get.

classitems.description: The type of object that it is.
classitems.name: objType

classitems.description:
The physics component contained on the Tilemap. Use for basic collisions between People and Tiles.
Note: That tilemap layers a immovable and collisions with tiles are set on the individual TileTypes that are contained on the TileMap.
classitems.name: physics

classitems.description: Returns the type of child that this is.

return.description: returns the type of child that the entity is

classitems.description: The type of object that it is.
classitems.name: objType

classitems.description: The tilemap that this TileMapLayer is a part of.
classitems.name: tilemap

classitems.description: Properties about that this TileMapLayer has when it was created from a JSON file.
classitems.name: properties

classitems.description: The width of this TileMap in tiles.
classitems.name: width

classitems.description: The height of this TileMap in tiles.
classitems.name: height

classitems.description: The width of a single tile.
classitems.name: tileWidth

classitems.description: The height of a single tile.
classitems.name: tileHeight

classitems.description: The texture atlas that should be used when rendering.
classitems.name: atlas

classitems.description: The width of the layer in pixels. This property is READ ONLY.
classitems.name: widthInPixels

classitems.description: The height of the layer in pixels. This property is READ ONLY.
classitems.name: heightInPixels

classitems.description:
Override function to prevent unwanted inherited behaviour. Do not call.

Because TileMapLayer extends Entity, it has a cellIndex parameter. However, it does not use a single atlas index, so this parameter is meaningless. It has deliberately been set to do nothing.
classitems.name: cellIndex

classitems.description: A list containing all the types of tiles found on this TileMapLayer.
classitems.name: _data

classitems.description: Returns the total number of tiles. Either for a particular type if passed, otherwise of any type if not passed.
classitems.name: countTiles

params.name: type
params.description: The type of tile you want to count.

return.description: The number of tiles on this layer.

classitems.description:
The orientation of the of tilemap. 
TileMaps can be either 'orthogonal' (normal) or 'isometric'.
classitems.name: orientation

classitems.description: A list containing all of the types of tiles found on this TileMapLayer. This is READ ONLY.
classitems.name: tileData

classitems.description:
Returns the index of the tile based on the x and y coordinates of the tile passed. 
If no tile is a the coordinates given then -1 is returned instead.
Coordinates are in tiles not pixels.
classitems.name: getIndexFromXY

params.name: x
params.description: The x coordinate of the Tile you would like to retrieve.

params.name: y
params.description: The y coordinate of the Tile you would like to retrieve.

return.description: Either the index of the tile retrieved or -1 if none was found.

classitems.description:
Returns the TileType for a tile that is at a particular set of coordinates passed. 
If no tile is found the null is returned instead.
Coordinates passed are in tiles.
classitems.name: getTileFromXY

classitems.description:
Returns the index of the tile based on the x and y pixel coordinates that are passed. 
If no tile is a the coordinates given then -1 is returned instead.
Coordinates are in pixels not tiles and use the world coordinates of the tilemap.
Note: Currently only working for ORTHOGONAL TileMaps.
classitems.name: getIndexFromCoords

params.name: x
params.description: The x coordinate of the Tile you would like to retrieve.

params.name: y
params.description: The y coordinate of the Tile you would like to retrieve.

return.description: Either the index of the tile retrieved or -1 if none was found.

classitems.description:
Returns the TileType for a tile that is at a particular coordinate passed. 
If no tile is found then null is returned instead.
Coordinates passed are in pixels and use the world coordinates of the tilemap.
Note: Currently only working for ORTHOGONAL TileMaps.
classitems.name: getTileFromCoords

classitems.description: Returns the indexes of every tile of a type you pass.
classitems.name: getIndexsByType

classitems.description:
Sets the tile to be used at the coordinates provided. 
Can be used to override a tile that may already exist at the location.
classitems.name: setTile

params.name: x
params.description: The coordinate of the tile on the x axis.

params.name: y
params.description: The coordinate of the tile on the y axis.

params.name: tileType
params.description: The type of tile that should be now used.

return.description: If a tile was changed or not.

classitems.description:
Sets the tile to be used at the index provided.
Can be used to override a tile that may already exist at the location.
classitems.name: setTileByIndex

params.name: index
params.description: The index of the tile that you want to change.

params.name: tileType
params.description: The new tile type to be used at that position.

classitems.description:
Randomizes the types of tiles used in an area of the layer. You can choose which types of tiles to use, and the area.
Default tile types used are everyone avaiable.
classitems.name: randomizeTiles

params.name: types
params.description: A list of TileTypes that can be used. Default is every tiletype on the TileMap.

params.name: x
params.description: The starting tile on the x axis to fill.

params.name: y
params.description: The starting tile on the y axis to fill.

params.name: width
params.description: How far across you want to go.

params.name: height
params.description: How far down you want to go.

classitems.description: Makes all of the tiles in the area specified a single type that is passed.
classitems.name: fill

params.name: type
params.description: The type of tile you want to fill in the area with.

params.name: x
params.description: The starting tile on the x axis to fill.

params.name: y
params.description: The starting tile on the y axis to fill.

params.name: width
params.description: How far across you want to go.

params.name: height
params.description: How far down you want to go.

classitems.description: Replaces all tiles of typeA to typeB in the area specified. If no area is specified then it is on the whole layer.
classitems.name: replaceTiles

params.name: typeA
params.description: The type of tile you want to be replaced.

params.name: typeB
params.description: The type of tile you want to be used instead.

params.name: x
params.description: The starting tile on the x axis to fill.

params.name: y
params.description: The starting tile on the y axis to fill.

params.name: width
params.description: How far across you want to go.

params.name: height
params.description: How far down you want to go.

classitems.description: Swaps all the tiles that are typeA -> typeB and typeB -> typeA inside the area specified. If no area is specified then it is on the whole layer.
classitems.name: swapTiles

params.name: typeA
params.description: The type of tile you want to be replaced with typeB.

params.name: typeB
params.description: The type of tile you want to be replaced with typeA.

params.name: x
params.description: The starting tile on the x axis to fill.

params.name: y
params.description: The starting tile on the y axis to fill.

params.name: width
params.description: How far across you want to go.

params.name: height
params.description: How far down you want to go.

classitems.description:
Returns the tiles which overlap with a provided entities hitbox component. 
Only collidable tiles on ANY side will be returned unless you pass a particular side.
Note: Only designed to work with ORTHOGONAL types of tilemaps, results maybe unexpected for other types of tilemaps.
classitems.name: getOverlappingTiles

params.name: entity
params.description: The entity you would like to check for the overlap.

params.name: collisionType
params.description: The particular type of collidable tiles which you would like to check for.

return.description: Returns an Array of Objects containing information about the tiles which were found. Index/X/Y information is contained within each Object.

classitems.description:
Returns the tiles which can collide with other objects (on ANY side unless otherwise specified) within an area provided.
By default the area is the whole tilemap.
classitems.name: getCollidableTiles

params.name: x
params.description: The x coordinate of the first tile to check.

params.name: y
params.description: The y coordinate of the first tile to check.

params.name: width
params.description: The width from the x coordinate.

params.name: height
params.description: The height from the y coordinate.

params.name: collisionType
params.description: The type of collidable tiles that should be return. By default ANY type of collidable tiles will be returned.

return.description: Returns an Array of Objects containing information about the tiles which were found. Index/X/Y information is contained within each Object.

classitems.description: The update loop that is executed when this TileMapLayer is add to the Stage.
classitems.name: update

classitems.description:
-----------------------
 Temp Properties used During Rendering
-----------------------

Used whilst rendering to calculate the number of tiles to be rendered on the X axis.
Is updated each frame, via the _calculateBoundaries method.
classitems.name: _maxX

classitems.description:
Used whilst rendering to calculate the number of tiles to be rendered on the Y axis.
Is updated each frame, via the _calculateBoundaries method.
classitems.name: _maxY

classitems.description:
Used whilst rendering to calculate which is the first tile to be rendered on the X axis.
Is updated each frame, via the _calculateBoundaries method.
classitems.name: _startX

classitems.description:
Used whilst rendering to calculate which is the first tile to be rendered on the Y axis.
Is updated each frame, via the _calculateBoundaries method.
classitems.name: _startY

classitems.description: Temporary property that holds the tileType of the current tile being rendered.
classitems.name: _temptype

classitems.description: Corner values used internally.
classitems.name: corner1

classitems.description: Corner values used internally.
classitems.name: corner2

classitems.description: Corner values used internally.
classitems.name: corner3

classitems.description: Corner values used internally.
classitems.name: corner4

classitems.description:
Used to calculate the position of the tilemap on the stage as well as how many tiles can fit on the screen. 
All coordinates calculated are stored as temporary properties (maxX/Y, startX/Y).
classitems.name: _calculateBoundaries

classitems.description:
ChartToScreen maps a point in the game tile coordinates into screen pixel
coordinates that indicate where the tile should be drawn.
Note: This is for use in ISOMETRIC Tilemaps.
classitems.name: chartToScreen

params.name: chartPt
params.description: A Object containing x/y properties of the tile.

params.name: tileW
params.description: The width of the tile

params.name: tileH
params.description: The height of the tile

return.description: With x/y properties of the location of the map onscreen.

classitems.description:
ScreenToChart maps a point in screen coordinates into the game tile chart
coordinates for the tile on which the screen point falls on.
This is for use in ISOMETRIC Tilemaps.
classitems.name: screenToChart

params.name: scrPt
params.description: An object containing x/y coordinates of the point on the screen you want to convert to tile coordinates.

params.name: tileW
params.description: The width of a single tile.

params.name: tileH
params.description: The height of a single tile.

return.description: With x/y properties of the location of tile on the screen.

The index of this tile type in the core map data.

This is so that the canvas doesn't render it every frame as it can be costly and so that it can be used in WebGL with the TextureAtlasRenderer.

classitems.description: The diameter of the circle
classitems.name: _diameter

classitems.description: The radius of the circle
classitems.name: _radius

classitems.description: The x coordinate of the center of the circle
classitems.name: x

classitems.description: The y coordinate of the center of the circle
classitems.name: y

classitems.description: The diameter of the circle. The largest distance between any two points on the circle. The same as the radius * 2.
classitems.name: diameter

classitems.description: The radius of the circle. The length of a line extending from the center of the circle to any point on the circle itself. The same as half the diameter.
classitems.name: radius

classitems.description: The circumference of the circle. This is READ ONLY.
classitems.name: circumference

classitems.description: The sum of the y and radius properties. Changing the bottom property of a Circle object has no effect on the x and y properties, but does change the diameter.
classitems.name: bottom

classitems.description: The x coordinate of the leftmost point of the circle. Changing the left property of a Circle object has no effect on the x and y properties. However it does affect the diameter, whereas changing the x value does not affect the diameter property.
classitems.name: left

classitems.description: The x coordinate of the rightmost point of the circle. Changing the right property of a Circle object has no effect on the x and y properties. However it does affect the diameter, whereas changing the x value does not affect the diameter property.
classitems.name: right

classitems.description: The sum of the y minus the radius property. Changing the top property of a Circle object has no effect on the x and y properties, but does change the diameter.
classitems.name: top

classitems.description: Gets the area of this Circle. Note this is READ ONLY.
classitems.name: area

classitems.description: Determines whether or not this Circle object is empty. This is READ ONLY.
classitems.name: isEmpty

return.description: A value of true if the Circle objects diameter is less than or equal to 0; otherwise false.

classitems.description: Returns a new Circle object with the same values for the x, y, width, and height properties as the original Circle object.
classitems.name: clone

params.name: [output
params.description: = Circle]  If given the values will be set into the object, otherwise a brand new Circle object will be created and returned.

classitems.description: Copies all of circle data from the source Circle object into the calling Circle object.
classitems.name: copyFrom

params.name: source
params.description: The source circle object to copy from

classitems.description: Copies all of circle data from this Circle object into the destination Circle object.
classitems.name: copyTo

params.name: circle
params.description: The destination circle object to copy in to

classitems.description: Returns the distance from the center of this Circle object to the given object (can be Circle, Point or anything with x/y values)
classitems.name: distanceTo

params.name: target
params.description: The destination Point object.

params.name: round
params.description: Round the distance to the nearest integer (default false)

return.description: The distance between this Point object and the destination Point object.

classitems.description: Determines whether the object specified in the toCompare parameter is equal to this Circle object. This method compares the x, y and diameter properties of an object against the same properties of this Circle object.
classitems.name: equals

params.name: toCompare
params.description: The circle to compare to this Circle object.

return.description: A value of true if the object has exactly the same values for the x, y and diameter properties as this Circle object; otherwise false.

classitems.description: Determines whether the Circle object specified in the toIntersect parameter intersects with this Circle object. This method checks the radius distances between the two Circle objects to see if they intersect.
classitems.name: intersects

params.name: toIntersect
params.description: The Circle object to compare against to see if it intersects with this Circle object.

return.description: A value of true if the specified object intersects with this Circle object; otherwise false.

classitems.description: Returns a Point object containing the coordinates of a point on the circumference of this Circle based on the given angle.
classitems.name: circumferencePoint

params.name: angle
params.description: The angle in radians (unless asDegrees is true) to return the point from.

params.name: asDegress
params.description: Is the given angle in radians (false) or degrees (true)?

params.name: output
params.description: An optional Point object to put the result in to. If none specified a new Point object will be created.

return.description: The Point object holding the result.

classitems.description: Adjusts the location of the Circle object, as determined by its center coordinate, by the specified amounts.

params.description: Moves the y value of the Circle object by this amount.

classitems.description:
Check to see if any two Lines intersect at any point. 
Both lines are treated as if they extend infintely through space.
classitems.name: lineToLine

params.name: line1
params.description: The first line object to check

params.name: line2
params.description: The second line object to check

params.name: output
params.description: An optional IntersectResult object to store the intersection values in. (One is created if none given)

return.description: An IntersectResult object containing the results of this intersection in x/y

classitems.description:
Check to see if a Line and a Line Segment intersect at any point. 
Note: The first line passed is treated as if it extends infinately though space, 
The second is treated as if it only exists between its two points.
classitems.name: lineToLineSegment

params.name: line1
params.description: The first line to check. This is the one that will extend through space infinately.

params.name: seg
params.description: The second line to check. This is the one that will only exist between its two coordinates.

params.name: output
params.description: An optional IntersectResult object to store the intersection values in (one is created if none given)

return.description: An IntersectResult object containing the results of this intersection.

classitems.description:
Checks to see if a Line that is passed, intersects at any point another Line that is made by passing a set of coordinates to this method. 
Note: The first line will extend infinately through space. 
And the second line will only exist between the two points passed.
classitems.name: lineToRawSegment

params.name: line
params.description: The line object that extends infinatly through space.

params.name: x1
params.description: The x coordinate of the first point in the second line.

params.name: y1
params.description: The y coordinate of the first point in the second line.

params.name: x2
params.description: The x coordinate of the second point in the second line.

params.name: y2
params.description: The y coordinate of the second point in the second line.

params.name: output
params.description: An optional IntersectResult object to store the intersection values in (one is created if none given)

return.description: An IntersectResult object containing the results of this intersection in x/y

classitems.description:
Checks to see if a Line and Ray object intersects at any point. 
Note: The line in this case extends infinately through space.
classitems.name: lineToRay

params.name: line1
params.description: The Line object that extends infinatly through space.

params.name: ray
params.description: The Ray object that you want to check it against.

params.name: An
params.description: optional IntersectResult object to store the intersection values in (one is created if none given)

return.description: An IntersectResult object containing the results of this intersection in x/y

classitems.description:
Checks to see if a Line and a Circle intersect at any point.
Note: The line passed is assumed to extend infinately through space.
classitems.name: lineToCircle

params.name: line
params.description: The Line object that you want to check it against.

params.name: circle
params.description: The Circle object to check.

params.name: output
params.description: An optional IntersectResult object to store the intersection values in (one is created if none given)

return.description: An IntersectResult object containing the results of this intersection

classitems.description:
Check if the Line intersects with each side of a Rectangle.
Note: The Line is assumned to extend infinately through space.
classitems.name: lineToRectangle

classitems.description:
Determines a point between two specified points. The parameter f determines where the new interpolated point is located relative to the two end points specified by parameters pt1 and pt2.
The closer the value of the parameter f is to 1.0, the closer the interpolated point is to the first point (parameter pt1). The closer the value of the parameter f is to 0, the closer the interpolated point is to the second point (parameter pt2).
classitems.name: interpolate

params.name: pointA
params.description: The first Point object.

params.name: pointB
params.description: The second Point object.

params.name: f
params.description: The level of interpolation between the two points. Indicates where the new point will be, along the line between pt1 and pt2. If f=1, pt1 is returned; if f=0, pt2 is returned.

classitems.description: If the Rectangle object specified in the toIntersect parameter intersects with this Rectangle object, returns the area of intersection as a Rectangle object. If the rectangles do not intersect, this method returns an empty Rectangle object with its properties set to 0.

params.name: toIntersect

return.description: A Rectangle object that equals the area of intersection. If the rectangles do not intersect, this method returns an empty Rectangle object; that is, a rectangle with its x, y, width, and height properties set to 0.

classitems.description: Determines whether the object specified in the toIntersect parameter intersects with this Rectangle object. This method checks the x, y, width, and height properties of the specified Rectangle object to see if it intersects with this Rectangle object.

params.name: toIntersect

This method is used to remove existing DOM elements and place them inside a HUDWidget's container element.
Useful so that when making HUD Widgets the developer can style HUDWidgets without having to create/write to much javascript.

Currently doesn't have great support.

classitems.description:
A Signal that dispatches events when a key is released/is now up.
Callbacks fired by this Signal will contain two parameters, the keyCode and key object.
1) KeyCode - The keyCode of the key that was just released.
2) Key - The key object for that keycode.
classitems.name: onKeyUp

classitems.description:
A Signal that dispatches events when a key is pressed/is down.
This mimics the natural 'keydown' event listener, so it will keep dispatching events if the user holds the key down. 
Note: This fires after the 'onKeyDownOnce' signal.
Callbacks fired by this Signal will contain two parameters, the keyCode and key object.
1) KeyCode - The keyCode of the key that was just released.
2) Key - The key object for that keycode.
classitems.name: onKeyDown

classitems.description:
A Signal that dispatches events when a key is pressed/is down initially. 
This event only fires the first time that the key is pressed, so it won't dispatch events if the user is holding the key down.
Note: This fires before the 'onKeyDown' signal;
Callbacks fired by this Signal will contain two parameters, the keyCode and key object.
1) KeyCode - The keyCode of the key that was just released.
2) Key - The key object for that keycode.
classitems.name: onKeyDownOnce

classitems.description: Adds the event listeners to the browser to listen for key events.
classitems.name: start

classitems.description: Removes the event listeners and so effectively 'stops' all keyboard events.
classitems.name: stop

classitems.description:
Is executed when a key is pressed/is down. This then either creates a new Key (if one does not currently exist) for that keycode, 
or it updates the key that was pressed (if one does exist).
classitems.name: onKeyDown

classitems.description:
Is executed when a key is release/is now up. This then either creates a new Key (if one does not currently exist) for that keycode, 
or it updates the key that was released (if one does exist).
classitems.name: onKeyUp

classitems.description:
Set a blend mode from a param object.

This is the main method for configuring blend modes on a renderer. It resolves to a pair of calls to blendEquationSeparate and blendFuncSeparate. The params object should specify compatible terms, namely { srcRGB: a, dstRGB: b, srcAlpha: c, dstAlpha: d, modeRGB: e, modeAlpha: f }. You should set abcdef using either direct calls to a gl context (ie. gl.SRC_ALPHA) or by using predefined strings.

The predefined string parameters for blendEquationSeparate are:

FUNC_ADD, FUNC_SUBTRACT, and FUNC_REVERSE_SUBTRACT.

The predefined string parameters for blendFuncSeparate are:

ZERO, ONE, SRC_COLOR, ONE_MINUS_SRC_COLOR, DST_COLOR, ONE_MINUS_DST_COLOR, SRC_ALPHA, ONE_MINUS_SRC_ALPHA, DST_ALPHA, ONE_MINUS_DST_ALPHA, SRC_ALPHA_SATURATE, CONSTANT_COLOR, ONE_MINUS_CONSTANT_COLOR, CONSTANT_ALPHA, and ONE_MINUS_CONSTANT_ALPHA.
classitems.name: readConfig

classitems.description: Formats a parameter into a GL context-compatible number. This recognises valid constant names, such as "SRC_ALPHA" or "REVERSE_AND_SUBTRACT", with some tolerance for case. It does not check for valid numeric codes.
classitems.name: makeConstant

classitems.description:
Sets a blend mode by name. Name is case-tolerant.

These are shortcuts to setting the blend function parameters manually. A listing of valid modes follows. Each is listed with the parameters modeRGB, modeAlpha, srcRGB, dstRGB, srcAlpha, and dstAlpha, constants used in the gl calls "blendEquationSeparate(modeRGB, modeAlpha)" and "blendFuncSeparate(srcRGB, dstRGB, srcAlpha, dstAlpha". This is very technical, and will probably only be useful if you are developing your own shaders for Kiwi.js.

"NORMAL" or any non-recognised string will draw as normal, blending colour via alpha. FUNC_ADD, FUNC_ADD, SRC_ALPHA, ONE_MINUS_SRC_ALPHA, ONE, ONE.

"ADD" or "ADDITIVE" will add pixels to the background, creating a lightening effect. FUNC_ADD, FUNC_ADD, SRC_ALPHA, ONE, ONE, ONE.

"SUBTRACT" or "SUBTRACTIVE" will subtract pixels from the background, creating an eerie dark effect. FUNC_REVERSE_SUBTRACT, FUNC_ADD, SRC_ALPHA, ONE, ONE, ONE.

"ERASE" or "ERASER" will erase the game canvas itself, allowing the page background to show through. You can later draw over this erased region. FUNC_REVERSE_SUBTRACT, FUNC_REVERSE_SUBTRACT, SRC_ALPHA, ONE_MINUS_SRC_ALPHA, ONE, ONE.

"BLACK" or "BLACKEN" will turn all colour black, but preserve alpha. FUNC_ADD, FUNC_ADD, ZERO, ONE_MINUS_SRC_ALPHA, ONE, ONE.

Blend modes as seen in Adobe Photoshop are not reliably available via WebGL blend modes. Such blend modes require shaders to create.

classitems.description:
An array of renderers. Shared renderers are used for batch rendering. Multiple gameobjects can use the same renderer
instance and add rendering info to a batch rather than rendering individually. 
This means only one draw call is necessary to render a number of objects. The most common use of this is standard 2d sprite rendering,
and the TextureAtlasRenderer is added by default as a shared renderer. Sprites, StaticImages and Tilemaps (core gameobjects) can all use the
same renderer/shader combination and be drawn as part of the same batch.
Custom gameobjects can also choose to use a shared renderer, fo example in the case that a custom gameobject's rendering requirements matched the TextureAtlasRenderer
capabilities.
classitems.name: _sharedRenderers

classitems.description:
Adds a renderer to the sharedRenderer array. The rendererID is a string that must match a renderer property of the Kiwi.Renderers object. 
If a match is found and an instance does not already exist, then a renderer is instantiated and added to the array.
classitems.name: addSharedRenderer

classitems.description:
Adds a cloned renderer to the sharedRenderer array. The rendererID is a string that must match a renderer property of the Kiwi.Renderers object. The cloneID is the name for the cloned renderer.

If a match is found and an instance does not already exist, then a renderer is instantiated and added to the array.

Cloned shared renderers are useful if some items in your scene will use a special shader or blend mode, but others will not. You can subsequently access the clones with a normal requestSharedRenderer() call. You should use this instead of requestRendererInstance() whenever possible, because shared renderers are more efficient than instances.
classitems.name: addSharedRendererClone

classitems.description: Requests a shared renderer. A game object that wants to use a shared renderer uses this method to obtain a reference to the shared renderer instance.
classitems.name: requestSharedRenderer

return.description: A shared renderer or null if none found.

classitems.description:
Requests a new renderer instance. This factory method is the only way gameobjects should instantiate their own renderer. 
The rendererID is a string that must match a renderer property of the Kiwi.Renderers object. 
If a match is found then a renderer is instantiated and returned. Gameobjects which have rendering requirements that do not suit
batch rendering use this technique.
classitems.name: requestRendererInstance

params.name: rendererID
params.description: The name of the requested renderer

return.description: A renderer or null if none found.

classitems.name: B_53

classitems.description: Holds the value for 2 to the power of 64 (2^64 = 18446744073709551616). This number cannot be accurately represented as a double-precision floating point whole number as it is greater than Kiwi.Utils.GameMath.B_53. It is represented as 18446744073709552000 in memory.

classitems.name: SIN_2PI_3

classitems.description:
Holds the value for 4 * (Math.sqrt(2) - 1) / 3.0 (approximately 0.5522847).

This is useful for making circular arcs with Bezier curves. For an arc segment of 90 degrees (PI / 2 radians) or less, you can construct a nice approximation using CIRCLE_ALPHA. If the magic number k = CIRCLE_ALPHA, construct an arc using the following points: [1,0], [1,k], [k,1], [0,1].

For angles that are smaller by scale n, scale k by n, and displace k along tangents of the arc. For more information, see this article by Hans Muller: http://hansmuller-flex.blogspot.com/2011/04/approximating-circular-arc-with-cubic.html
classitems.name: CIRCLE_ALPHA
